title: WATCH — Do they #GiveElsaAGirlfriend in Disney’s Frozen II?
text:
Can fans expect another Let it go? A melting Olaf?

For years, a group of Frozen fans has been pushing Disney to #GiveElsaAGirlfriend.

Now that the trailer is out for the sequel to the hugely popular 2013 movie, some people want to know: Is Elsa getting a girlfriend in Frozen II?

Hate to disappoint, but it doesn’t sound like it.

“She is not defined by a romantic relationship,” said Frozen II producer Peter Del Vecho when CBC Kids News contributor Spencer Barbosa asked him to dish on Elsa’s love life in the upcoming movie.

“That’s not where she’s at in her life.”

Of course, we’ll have to wait until the official release date — Nov. 22 — to know for sure.

But given how passionate some people have been about the topic on social media, the final confirmation is sure to ruffle some feathers.

So, if the movie isn’t about Elsa’s love interest, what is it about?

Del Vecho, who also produced the first Frozen movie and won an Oscar for it, said it’s all about understanding the source of Elsa’s magic powers — and their purpose.

“Where did they come from? What am I meant to do with them?” Elsa asks herself this time around.

“That’s the journey that she’s on,” Del Vecho said.

Although Frozen II doesn’t open in theatres until Nov. 22, Disney posted the official YouTube trailer on Sept. 23. (Disney)

Of course, part of what made the first Frozen movie such a huge success was the karaoke-worthy hit song Let it go.

Although Del Vecho talked about seven songs that “fit perfectly” into the upcoming movie, he didn’t single out one song as a possible billboard chart topper.

Disney may need to just let that dream go this time around.

Let it go, Disney. Just let it go.

Oscar award-winning Disney producer Peter Del Vecho says Frozen II is about understanding where Elsa’s magic powers come from and what she’s supposed to do with them. (Ricky Middlesworth/Disney)

Del Vecho hinted at one more detail that Frozen fans have been wondering about: Could Olaf the snowman melt in this next instalment of the franchise?

“Only if he feels that some people are worth melting for,” he said.

Yikes. Look out, Olaf!

Although Del Vecho didn’t confirm either way, it sounds like you might want to have some ice packs handy, just in case.

Will Olaf melt in Frozen II? 'Only if he feels that some people are worth melting for,' says Disney producer Peter Del Vecho. (Disney)
description: Does Elsa get a girlfriend in Frozen II? That’s what CBC Kids News contributor Spencer Barbosa asks producer Peter Del Vecho.
